intro: Topobea suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented lily, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun exposure. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces a cluster of white or pale pink flowers. Topobea suaveolens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant aroma.
